content.rendered:
The University of La Verne has a proud tradition of providing a supportive educational environment for veterans, service members who are active duty and Reserve, National Guard and military-connected spouses, registered domestic partners and dependents. Whether studying at the central campus in La Verne, at one of our regional campuses, at Naval Base Ventura County, or through La Verne Online, there are dedicated staff to assist you.

The Sara and Michael Abraham Center for Veteran Student Success (ACVSS) serves as a liaison to services, resources and programs on behalf of its military connected students. ACVSS advocates for and promotes veteran community, engagement, and assistance for successful educational experiences and outcomes.

Through the ACVSS, active duty military and veterans will have access to computers, printing and assistance with referrals to tutoring, psychological and counseling services, local VA and other resource services.

‘‘GI Bill® is a registered trademark of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (VA). More information about education benefits offered by VA is available at the official U.S. government Web site at https://www.benefits.va.gov/gibill.”
